key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan mark their son Archie's second birthday by advocating for COVID-19 vaccine equity.
The Sussexes have partnered with Archewell, their charitable organization, to support vaccine donations.
For every $5 donation, a number of organizations will contribute $15, enough to cover four vaccine doses.
The couple's statement highlights the global disparity in vaccine distribution, with 80% of doses administered in wealthier nations.
The Sussexes emphasize the importance of global solidarity and compassion in overcoming the pandemic.
They acknowledge the support and acts of charity from the public in honor of Archie's previous birthdays.
Archewell is collaborating with Global Citizen and Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, to promote worldwide vaccine access.
Harry and Meghan have sent an open letter to pharmaceutical companies, urging more support for the COVAX initiative.
COVAX aims to ensure equitable vaccine access for lower-income countries.
A correction clarifies that multiple organizations will match donations, not the Sussexes themselves.
